text:
5 minutes walk from MRT King Alfred Park station [DT16].
24 hrs Free admission. Very peaceful. Some people were resting and sleeping there. Long track for walking (+ dogs) and cycling.
There is a former Bukit Timah Railway station (small area). The former railway station staff quarter was reformed to a retro cafe besides a spicy garden.

ğŸ™ˆğŸ™ŠğŸ™‰A nostalgic place that has been restored and beautified.
Can image how life must have been in those days.
Great photography opportunities.
ğŸ’Bukit Timah Railway Station Community Node consist of
-Bukit Timah Railway Station
-Railway Staff Quarters
-Kampong Garden
-Herb and Spice Garden
-Yard Shelter with toilet
-Event Lawn
ğŸ’The Railway Staff Quarters were renovated and refurblished to house a Cafe, named 1932 Story.
ğŸ’Two new gardens were added on both sides of the Staff Quarters.
The Kampong Garden and Herb and Spice Garden.

Located by the Bukit Timah Area, this spot provides you with great scenery to take a short walk / hike. You can also learn the brief history of old railway system in Singapore while taking a short break.

Serving as the historical site, this place has been maintained really well and you can take some nice photos at the spot - given how all of the remnants are still on its prime conditions.
A historical railway station with spacious space for visitor to drop by and photo shooting! Nice space planning

Itâ€™s so beautiful here!!â€™ I felt like I stepped into 1970s. There isnâ€™t a high rise building in sight. The seats are a nice touch. The old maps are so nice! Is a nice outdoor museum along the rail corridor. Good job, whoever did this! Thank u. The two carriages are also quite fun to ride on.
